heading: Custom User Controls

explains.public string Hint {}: This is a property. We are using this because it allows us to change the value of 'Hint' from the visual designer
explains.get: This is used to get the Hint applied to this Control
explains.set: This is used to set the Hint applied to this Control, and also display the hint on the TextBox if it is empty
explains._Hint: To avoid loop problems with the property, we need to have a separate variable to store the Hint

exampleDescription:
In this example we will create a Textbox that displays a placeholder/hint. This is useful because we don't need to have a label beside our TextBox to tell the user what it's for.

The first step is to create a Custom User Control in your project:


Since, in our example, we are making a type of TextBox, we will change our custom control to inherit from a TextBox, instead of a UserControl: 
 public partial class HintTextBox : TextBox

After this we just need to add code to store the Hint, and add listeners to determine when to display the hint
